messages.content: IC-Light-ComfyUI-Node is a custom node for ComfyUI that integrates the IC-Light model for image generation.
Where can I find the original repository for IC-Light?
The original repository for IC-Light is located at https://github.com/lllyasviel/IC-Light/.
What are the available models for IC-Light-ComfyUI-Node?

There are two available models for IC-Light-ComfyUI-Node: lllyasviel/ic-light and digiplay/Photon_v1, which can be found at https://huggingface.co/lllyasviel/ic-light/tree/main and https://huggingface.co/digiplay/Photon_v1/tree/main, respectively.
Where should the IC-Light models be placed within the ComfyUI directory?
The IC-Light models should be placed in the `ComfyUI/models/unet` directory.
No, IC-Light-ComfyUI-Node is not a standalone application. It is a custom node that extends the functionality of ComfyUI.
Can I use IC-Light-ComfyUI-Node without installing ComfyUI?
No, you cannot use IC-Light-ComfyUI-Node without installing ComfyUI, as it is a custom node designed specifically for ComfyUI.
What is the purpose of integrating IC-Light models into ComfyUI?
The purpose of integrating IC-Light models into ComfyUI is to enhance the image generation capabilities of ComfyUI by utilizing the IC-Light models.
